constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 34 (Tuesday, February 23, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. BOST:
H.R. 1216.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution,
which states ``[t]he Congress shall have power to lay and
collect taxes, duties, imposts and excises, to pay the debts
and provide for the common defense and general welfare of the
United States; but all duties, imposts and excises shall be
uniform throughout the United States''.
[Page H588]
title: Modernizing Veterans’ Health Care Eligibility Act
